poem:
**Quarterly**

So much depends  
upon  

a red graph  
in the morning paper  
glazed with 4.3%  

beside the copper  
rally  

and the small  
imports  
that fall away—  

under the tariff's  
shadow,  

the dollar  
thin  
in its basket  

while consumers  
lift  
their bright packages.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US economic growth surges to fastest rate in two years – business live 1.37pm GMT US economic growth beats forecasts in Q3 Newsflash: US economic growth accelerated in the third quarter of this year, to the fastest rate in two years. US real gross domestic product (GDP) increased at an annualised rate of 4.3% in the July-September period, the US Bureau of Economic Analysis reports, up from 3.8% in April-June. That beats Wall Street forecasts that growth would slow to 3.3%, and is the fastest growth recorded for the US economy since the third quarter of 2023. Annualised growth of 4.3% is the equivalent of quarterly growth of almost 1.1%, much faster than the UK which only grew by 0.1% in Q3. The increase in real GDP in the third quarter was due to increases in consumer spending, exports, and government spending that were partly offset by a decrease in investment. Imports, which are a subtraction in the calculation of GDP, decreased, the BEA explains. Updated at 1.44pm GMT 12.42pm GMT The copper price rally is also being fuelled by fears that President Donald Trump’s administration could impose additional import tariffs on copper next year. Bloomberg says the possibility that Trump will place tariffs on the metal has been a central factor driving prices higher, with a surge in US imports through the year thrusting manufacturers elsewhere into a bidding war to keep hold of supplies. 12.39pm GMT The US dollar is its lowest in 11 weeks against a basket". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: US economic growth surges to fastest rate in two years – business live 1.37pm GMT US economic growth beats forecasts in Q3 Newsflash: US economic growth accelerated in the third quarter of this year, to the fastest rate in two years. US real gross domestic product (GDP) increased at an annualised rate of 4.3% in the July-September period, the US Bureau of Economic Analysis reports, up from 3.8% in April-June. That beats Wall Street forecasts that growth would slow to 3.3%, and is the fastest growth recorded for the US economy since the third quarter of 2023. Annualised growth of 4.3% is the equivalent of quarterly growth of almost 1.1%, much faster than the UK which only grew by 0.1% in Q3. The increase in real GDP in the third quarter was due to increases in consumer spending, exports, and government spending that were partly offset by a decrease in investment. Imports, which are a subtraction in the calculation of GDP, decreased, the BEA explains. Updated at 1.44pm GMT 12.42pm GMT The copper price rally is also being fuelled by fears that President Donald Trump’s administration could impose additional import tariffs on copper next year. Bloomberg says the possibility that Trump will place tariffs on the metal has been a central factor driving prices higher, with a surge in US imports through the year thrusting manufacturers elsewhere into a bidding war to keep hold of supplies. 12.39pm GMT The US dollar is its lowest in 11 weeks against a basket
